Problem:
Consider a linear integral transformation given by \\(I[f(t)] = \\int_{0}^{\\infty} K(t, s) f(s) ds\\), where \\(K(t, s)\\) is a kernel function. We investigate the impact of a control function \\( h(s) \\) added to the input function \\( f(s) \\), resulting in a modified input \\( f(s) + h(s) \\).

Given the output of the transformation, \\( I[f(t)] \\) when \\( h(s) = 0 \\), can we trace back uniquely to the function \\( f(s) \\) without knowing whether a control function was applied?
Explanation: Determining the original function \\( f(s) \\) uniquely from \\( I[f(t)] \\) is not feasible without explicit knowledge of \\( h(s) \\). Any modifications by \\( h(s) \\), unless zero, cannot be distinguished solely from the output.
